body_html:
Thanks for such a quick response !
You are right that the dynamic_rnn can't fill in the unknown time steps but really it should stop at max of seq_len and can thus, fill in this dimension (am I expecting too much ?).
Yeah the attention mechanism currently requires the size of input to be known. Thanks for the heads up about the new version. But how are you guys planning on handling this. Is it a matter of upgrading Tensorflow or is there something that can be done in the current version itself ?

Thanks for such a quick response !
You are right that the dynamic_rnn can't fill in the unknown time steps but really it should stop at max of seq_len and can thus, fill in this dimension (am I expecting too much ?).
Yeah the attention mechanism currently requires the size of input to be known. Thanks for the heads up about the new version. But how are you guys planning on handling this. Is it a matter of upgrading Tensorflow or is there something that can be done in the current version itself ?
body:
Thanks for such a quick response !
You are right that the dynamic_rnn can't fill in the unknown time steps but really it should stop at max of seq_len and can thus, fill in this dimension (am I expecting too much ?).
Yeah the attention mechanism currently requires the size of input to be known. Thanks for the heads up about the new version. But how are you guys planning on handling this. Is it a matter of upgrading Tensorflow or is there something that can be done in the current version itself ?
